My Creative Process

While the sequence and application may vary depending on the needs of the project, I always use the following steps as guidelines to stay organized

1

Analyze

Before I start building any course, I first research to see if building a course is even the right solution. If it is, I search for learning gaps and the learner's perspective to guide me to make appropriate design decisions.

2

Outline

As early as appropriate for the project, I put together an outline and mockup of the course. I create my design using tailored strategies to meet the learners needs, utilizing the information I gain during analysis.

3

Script

This phase includes writing out the content of the course, including text as well as the audio and video transcripts.

4

Create Media

During this phase, I record, edit, and finalize the media content to ensure that the course is engaging and tailored to the learners.

5

Fine-Tune

When the course has been built, I and the client conduct a final review to make sure the course is everything the client dreamed it to be. I then make the remaining adjustments, if any.

6

Implement

Now that the course is finalized and approved, I implement the course so that the learning can begin. I remain on call to make any further edits based off of learner feedback and course performance.
